info.title: FactSet
info.description: Automate your workflows using the FactSet Connector to stay on top of relevant news and events for companies of interest, highlight important topics to drive your discussions, prepare for meetings, and more.

parameters.name: created[gt]
parameters.description: Lower bound for filtering by created date. Example, 2021-01-01T00:00:00.000Z

parameters.name: created[lt]
parameters.description: Upper bound for filtering by created date. Example, 2021-01-01T00:00:00.000Z

parameters.name: signalIds
parameters.description: Comma delimited list of signals

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Comma delimited string of identifiers. An identifier can be a ticker, FactSet entity id, CUSIP or ISIN

parameters.name: userRelevanceScore[gt]
parameters.description: Lower bound for filtering by userRelevanceScore

parameters.name: userRelevanceScore[lt]
parameters.description: Upper bound for filtering by userRelevanceScore

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Comma delimited string of sortable attributes

parameters.name: userRelevanceScore[gte]
parameters.description: Greater than or equal to userRelevanceScore
parameters.x-ms-summary: User Relevance Score Greater Than Or Equal To

parameters.name: userRelevanceScore[lte]
parameters.description: Less than or equal to userRelevanceScore
parameters.x-ms-summary: User Relevance Score Less Than Or Equal To

parameters.name: updated[gt]
parameters.description: Lower bound for filtering by update date. Example, 2021-01-01T00:00:00.000Z

parameters.name: updated[lt]
parameters.description: Upper bound for filtering by update date. Example, 2021-01-01T00:00:00.000Z

parameters.name: created[gte]
parameters.description: Greater than or equal to create date. Example, 2021-01-01T00:00:00.000Z
parameters.x-ms-summary: Created Date Greater Than or Equal To

parameters.name: updated[gte]
parameters.description: Greater than or equal to update date. Example, 2021-01-01T00:00:00.000Z
parameters.x-ms-summary: Update Date Greater Than or Equal To

parameters.name: created[lte]
parameters.description: Less than or equal to create date. Example, 2021-01-01T00:00:00.000Z
parameters.x-ms-summary: Create Date Less Than or Equal To

parameters.name: updated[lte]
parameters.description: Less than or equal to update date. Example, 2021-01-01T00:00:00.000Z
parameters.x-ms-summary: Update Date Less Than or Equal To

parameters.name: portfolios
parameters.description: Name of a portfolio file stored by FactSet

parameters.name: themes
parameters.description: Comma delimited list of theme ids

parameters.name: categories
parameters.description: Comma delimited list of categories

get.description: Fetch Microsoft's Adaptive Cards, which includes headlines and event details data plus hyperlinks to FactSet reports, based on the filtering criteria

text.description: English plain-text from which entities should be retrieved. Maximum of 10,000 characters

enableIdLookup.description: Retrieve Entity IDs using FactSet concordance systems.

filterEntities.description: Drop potentially spurious entities based on filtering rules.

post.description: Extract named entities from document text.

get.description: Retrieves the list of books that were previously created and are available in the client's book library

A template is a predefined list of content to be compiled in a PDF. This end point works without any parameters and retrieves the list of templates available for the user. Templates need to defined/created in FactSet workstation.

post.description: This endpoint retrieves book status, book name, and book ID for ticker requested in JSON format. This end-point accepts ticker and template_id as inputs. If the template_id input is not used, a book will be created with FactSet's default template.

get.description: This endpoint will return the PDF output given a book_id.

parameters.name: book_id
parameters.description: ID of the book to download

inputSymbolType.description: The type of identifier inputted in the request

frefListingExchange.description: The 3 digit fref exchange code for the primary exchange of the security

< * >.description: The Key in the Key-Value pair is the name of the requested outputSymbolType. The Value in the Key-Value is the requestId translated to the outputSymbolType.

data.description: Response object for Identifier Resolution endpoint.

get.description: Translate Entity ID and market security symbols into FactSet Permanent Security Identifiers.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Requested security or entity identifiers. All requested identifiers must be of the same type.

parameters.name: inputSymbolType
parameters.description: The type of symbol being inputted. Only one type of symbol is accepted with each request.

parameters.name: outputSymbolTypes
parameters.description: The type of symbols being outputted. Multiple types of symbols can be outputted with each request. The user must be authorized for the requested identifier type.
